Row.Text: Aiyy are benevolent spirits in Yakuts mythology. They are creators of the world and of the fabulous land of the Yakut Olonkhos. In Sakha belief, creator of the world "Urung Ai Toyon", is the greatest of them.
According to mythology, the Aiyy live in the Upper World. It is believed that the Aiyy will not accept blood sacrifice and therefore they are presented "victims" of vegetable and dairy products.
Aiyy symbols are required for the Ysyakh (spring feast) and regulated by the government of the Sakha Republic.

Siberia, in particular Yakutia, is of paleontological significance, as it contains bodies of prehistoric animals from the Pleistocene Epoch, preserved in ice or permafrost. In 2015, the frozen bodies of Dina and Uyan the cave lion cubs were found. The region was also host to the bodies of Yuka and another Woolly mammoth from Oymyakon, a Woolly rhinoceros from the Kolyma River, and bison and horses from Yukagir. The Turkic Sakha people or Yakuts probably settled in the area in the 13th and 14th centuries, migrating north from the Lake Baikal area to the middle Lena. From their new center along the middle Lena they gradually expanded northeast and west beyond the Lena basin towards the Arctic Ocean.

The name Sakha is of Turkic origin, "saqa-saha" meaning "cue" or "bat". The term yakut is a Turkic word, a corruption of zhaqut - yakut "precious stone", referring to the ruby. The Sakha displaced earlier, much smaller populations who lived on hunting and reindeer herding, introducing the pastoralist economy of Central Asia. The indigenous populations of Paleosiberian and Tungusic stock were mostly assimilated to the Sakha by the 17th century. In August 1638, the Moscow Government formed a new administrative unit with the administrative center of Lensky Ostrog (Fort Lensky), the future city of Yakutsk, which had been founded by Pyotr Beketov in 1632.

Russian settlers began to form a community in the 18th century, which adopted certain Yakut customs and was often called Yakutyane (Якутя́не) or Lena Early Settlers (ленские старожилы). However, the influx of later settlers assimilated them into the Russian mainstream by the 20th century. In an administrative reform of 1782, Irkutsk Governorate was created. In 1805, Yakutsk Oblast was split from Irkutsk Governorate.

On 27 April 1922, former Yakutsk Oblast was proclaimed the Yakut ASSR, although in fact the eastern part of the territory, including the city of Yakutsk, was controlled by the White Russians (see Yakut Revolt). In 1992, after the fall of the Soviet Union, Yakutia was recognized in Moscow as the Sakha (Yakutia) Republic under the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation. Yakutia is historically part of Russian Siberia, but since the formation of the Far Eastern Federal District in 2000, it is administratively part of the Russian Far East.

Industry generates slightly above 50% of the gross national product of Sakha, stemming primarily from mineral exploitation. Industrial enterprises are concentrated in the capital Yakutsk, as well as in Aldan, Mirny, Neryungri, Pokrovsk, and Udachny. The diamond, gold and tin ore mining industries are the major focus of the economy. Uranium ore is beginning to be mined. Turkic-language Sakha are in politics, government, finance, economy and cattle-breeding (horses and cows for milk and meat). The Paleoasian indigenous peoples are hunters, fishermen, and reindeer herders. As of 2008, Sakha Republic is the 19th most developed federal subject in Russia.

O wise and steadfast Elley Bootur, under your wise leadership our people flourish in harmony with the majestic landscapes of their homeland. Your guidance transforms the challenges of the tundra into opportunities, nurturing a culture rich in tradition and resilience. As you lead our people, your wisdom and strength inspire prosperity and unity, forging a legacy that resonates through the ages.

According to legends, the progenitor of all Sakha was Elley Bootur (Boğotur), who was of Turkic origin and who fled to the middle course of the Lena, running from a great war or persecution. Elley Bootur married the daughter of Omogoy Bay, who had been of Mongol (Buryat) descent and who had also fled to the north when the wars during the Genghis Khan rule (?) broke out, and who settled down in the delta of the Chara River (a tributary of the Eoliueokhiume (Russian: Olyokma)) near the Lena about 300 miles from present-day Yakutsk.

The ritual funerary complexes correspond to the Ust-Talkin culture, which alongside with cranial features of the man enable us to associate Sergelyakh burial with Turkic part of the Sakha people, which is epically correlated with the legendary Elley Bootur.
Greetings, noble traveler. I am Elley, ruler of the Sakha. May our meeting be the start of a prosperous friendship.
Join us for a feast in our lands. We shall share the warmth of our hearth and the stories of our ancestors.
With honor, we accept your invitation and look forward to learning of your people's ways.
We've heard tales of your grand capital. Might we be graced with its sights?
Welcome back, friend. What news do you bring?
Your delegation is most welcome. They shall witness the unity and joy of our people.
We must humbly decline, as now is a time of solemn reflection for us.
Our envoys carry gifts of fur and song. May they be a bridge of friendship between us.
Your offer opens the path to greater understanding and trust.
Now is not the time, but let us revisit this offer in the future.
May our people journey freely across our lands, that they may learn and grow together?
In unity, there is strength. Let our friendship be a beacon in these lands.
It seems our paths are yet to converge, noble one.
Friend, let us unite our peoples under a banner of peace and understanding.
We respect your decision and remain hopeful for future accord.
Together, as allies, we can create a legacy of prosperity and peace.
Your leadership is a testament to the virtues of wisdom and patience.
One must lead with both strength and compassion. Do your people feel your heart in your rule?
Your warriors loom close to our lands. We trust this is not a harbinger of conflict.
This agreement paves the way for mutual prosperity. Let us go forth together.
This does not seem to be in our people's best interests at this time.
Your words are heard, but let us hope for understanding in the future.
It grieves me to see our paths diverge in such a manner. May wisdom guide you back.
Though peace is our wish, we will stand resilient in the face of conflict.
It is with a heavy heart that we take up arms to protect our people and our lands.
Let us put an end to this strife and renew our pursuit of peace.
The time for peace has not yet arrived, but may it be on the horizon.
Our people yearn for peace. Let us end this conflict and move forward together.
Though defeated, the spirit of our people remains unbroken. We will rise again, stronger and wiser.
Permanent 50% discount on purchasing city tiles.
+1 [Icon_Food] Food and +1 [Icon_Production] Production from Tundra and Tundra Hills tiles. +1 [Icon_Food] Food from Snow and Snow Hills tiles.
A building unique to Sakha that provides +1 [Icon_Faith] Faith, +1 [Icon_Culture] Culture, and +1 [Icon_Science] Science. Built in City Center.
A building unique to Sakha that provides +1 [Icon_Faith] Faith, +1 [Icon_Culture] Culture, +1 [Icon_Science] Science, and +1 Loyalty. Built in City Center.

This place, often associated with the Yhyakh festival, an important summer event, bustles with life and color. Here, under the endless expanse of the Siberian sky, locals gather to celebrate the sun with traditional dances, songs, and games. The air is filled with the aroma of freshly prepared local delicacies, and the sounds of ancient rituals blend with modern festivity. Yhyakh Place is not just a location; it's a living mosaic of the Sakha people's enduring traditions and their harmonious relationship with nature.
A unique Ancient era unit that replaces Heavy Chariot. Does not require Horses to build. Upgrades to Great Booturs.
A unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight. Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking. Upgrades to Tank.
